unit.utterance: Bara.

unit.utterance_translation: and they said,

unit.utterance: "Enam pasi kabuu vue a taba an,
unit.utterance_translation: "We will prepare the food for her,

unit.utterance: me paa mee nasu e Taguone tea atono team.
unit.utterance_translation: and bring Taguone over to leave (her) with you.

unit.utterance: A beiko team paa hinou bene Taguone, enam pasi mee nasu vuee.
unit.utterance_translation: Your child has requested Taguone, we will bring her over.

unit.utterance: Mea peha taba goe ta vapuripurihi ee a suinnae,
unit.utterance_translation: There is one thing, do not let her get wet, her body

unit.utterance: saka manin pita haana tea tahii,
unit.utterance_translation: (she) must not walk in the sea at all,

unit.utterance: samin pita haana tea tahii, samin -
unit.utterance_translation: (she) must not walk in the sea at all, must not-

unit.utterance: a - sisibu haana tea ruene.
unit.utterance_translation: ah - bathe in the river.

unit.utterance: Eam kona nom, o meho matapaku tei tea nabunuu
unit.utterance_translation: You know, we had other practices in the past,

unit.utterance: tenam sa siisisibu haa roho,
unit.utterance_translation: (we) did not bathe,

unit.utterance: konoboo overe konoboo tamuana koa tea maa - maa "
unit.utterance_translation: (we) always only used coconut oil ...-"

unit.utterance: Be gita, orepaa konoboo habana
unit.utterance_translation: When (it) was dried up, they would use oil again,

unit.utterance: tea nubunubu orepaa havihavi bona suinriori
unit.utterance_translation: in the morning they would wipe their bodies

unit.utterance: tea nahu konoboo teori na hio nana inu,
unit.utterance_translation: (taking the oil) from their oil pot sitting in the house,

unit.utterance: orepaa boha voen paa ruvu mau ruene ahiki,
unit.utterance_translation: they said that (she) had not dived in the water, no,

unit.utterance: paa vahavihavi taono koau
unit.utterance_translation: (she) had only wiped her skin

unit.utterance: teo konoboo,
unit.utterance_translation: with oil,

unit.utterance: o konoboo o beera to paa paku riori, erau meori paa sue kiri bari,
unit.utterance_translation: much oil they had to make, and then they said to them,

unit.utterance: "Pasi tii koa vo nom enei, samin sisibu haana,
unit.utterance_translation: "(she) must be like this, (she) should never bathe,

unit.utterance: antee nana tea paku bona - a mohina
unit.utterance_translation: (she) can make a garden,

unit.utterance: antee nana tea - tea - tea ubi, tea vateen naono maa
unit.utterance_translation: (she) can collect firewood, bring firewood in the backpack

unit.utterance: bara tea nahunahu, na antee nana tea paku bona maa kiu bona.
unit.utterance_translation: and cook, (she) can do these kinds of work.

unit.utterance: Evehee tea sisibu, ahiki.
unit.utterance_translation: But bathing, no.

unit.utterance: Tii nana a - a taba teve vaasisibu tevei o konoboo teve."
unit.utterance_translation: That's it. Her thing to bathe with is her oil."

unit.utterance: Meori paa mee bari,
unit.utterance_translation: And they brought her,

unit.utterance: mee vai ori teo - teo bon vai, ore he matatopo bona taba an.
unit.utterance_translation: they brought (her) on this day, and whereas they (the boy's relatives) would prepare the food.

unit.utterance: Meori paa mee bene Taguone tea atono te - te roanabai teve
unit.utterance_translation: And they brought Taguone to leave her with her mother-in-law

unit.utterance: ae te avue teve, roanabai otei, roanabai moon.
unit.utterance_translation: and her sister in-law, the male in-laws, the female in-laws.

unit.utterance: Meori paa nao, amaa avue teve na matatopo bona taba an
unit.utterance_translation: And they went, her sister in-laws prepared the food

unit.utterance: to kahi an nana eve amaa raen te Taguone,
unit.utterance_translation: that she was going to eat, Taguone's people (lit line/group),

unit.utterance: orepaa nomaa vahaa,
unit.utterance_translation: they came back,

unit.utterance: "Bara, enam ei, enam paa mee mau e Taguone tea atono,
unit.utterance_translation: "Alright, we are here, we have brought Taguone to leave (her here with you),

unit.utterance: eam paa kikira vamataa nia sahata tenam."
unit.utterance_translation: you take good care of our dear."

unit.utterance: "Ah, enam pasi kikira ni vuee",
unit.utterance_translation: "Yes, we will take care of her."

unit.utterance: e roanabai teve kou ei.
unit.utterance_translation: this was her mother-in-law.

unit.utterance: Erau, atono vai niori meori paa an,
unit.utterance_translation: And so they left (her there) and they ate,

unit.utterance: an bona taba an meori paa nao vahaa,
unit.utterance_translation: ate the food and they went again,

unit.utterance: nao vaha maa inu teori,
unit.utterance_translation: went again to their house,

unit.utterance: evehee e roanabai teve
unit.utterance_translation: but her mother-in-law

unit.utterance: saka kiikira vamataa haana bene Taguone.
unit.utterance_translation: did not take good care of Taguone.

unit.utterance: Meori paa mee bari tahii teo - teo peho bon,
unit.utterance_translation: They took her to the sea one day,

unit.utterance: nao tahii meori paa vagana maa,
unit.utterance_translation: went to the sea and they fished,

unit.utterance: vagana maa am- o va- o kaku vagana tea maa moon,
unit.utterance_translation: fished [STUTTERING]- the women's kind of fishing,

unit.utterance: tea maa moon tenam ei Teapu ei na vaavaha nana,
unit.utterance_translation: of our women here in Teop, this is different,

unit.utterance: na gono batari bona maa vahara taba tahii (a) maa (ru)tarutaa
unit.utterance_translation: (they) get the little things from the sea, the small ones,

unit.utterance: beori vaaobete batari tea bonaa,
unit.utterance_translation: when they put (them) into the fishing basket,

unit.utterance: orepaa bero, bero, bero bero maa kakukaku taba,
unit.utterance_translation: so that there are many, many different kinds of things

unit.utterance: orepaa ma nahu bari.
unit.utterance_translation: to cook. (lit: so that they come and cook them)

unit.utterance: Erau nao vai tea vagana tea maa moon.
unit.utterance_translation: And so (Taguone and her mother-in-law) went fishing in the women's way.

unit.utterance: Meori vagana, meori vagana, meori vagana,
unit.utterance_translation: And they fished, and they fished, and they fished,

unit.utterance: gono bona maa taba (a) maa bero.
unit.utterance_translation: got many things.

unit.utterance: Evehee, e roanabai teve
unit.utterance_translation: But her mother-in-law

unit.utterance: toro sue - toro vadadao,
unit.utterance_translation: should have said - should have called,

unit.utterance: "Are nao (a) puhana mene na puhana bata maana,
unit.utterance_translation: "Let's go, otherwise the tide will be too high,

unit.utterance: irihi a gohoho.
unit.utterance_translation: the edge of the reef is flooded by the in-coming tide.

unit.utterance: A- a tahii na taneo bata maana tea nomaa
unit.utterance_translation: The sea starts coming,

unit.utterance: ii gina irihi."
unit.utterance_translation: here over the edge of the reef."

unit.utterance: Evehee ahiki, sa sue haa,
unit.utterance_translation: But no, (she) did not say (anything),

unit.utterance: nao - na tei umee koa bene Taguone,
unit.utterance_translation: (she) went, had just forgotten Taguone,

unit.utterance: meo puhana paa beera maa me beera maa,
unit.utterance_translation: and the tide became higher and higher,

unit.utterance: me nomaa moonae
unit.utterance_translation: and got to her legs,

unit.utterance: me nomaa moonae,
unit.utterance_translation: and got to her legs,

unit.utterance: me antee enei o puhanai.
unit.utterance_translation: and the high-tide reached until here (Iarabee is pointing to her knees).

unit.utterance: Eve- e- e roanabai teve he sue
unit.utterance_translation: She - the - but her mother-in-law said,

unit.utterance: "He! E Taguone,
unit.utterance_translation: "Hey, Taguone,

unit.utterance: enaa paa umee vuru,
unit.utterance_translation: I have forgotten,

unit.utterance: enaa paa umee vuru tea sue,
unit.utterance_translation: I have forgotten to say,

unit.utterance: eara re vakah(u) tea masi.
unit.utterance_translation: let us hurry to the dry reef.

unit.utterance: O puhana paa beera vaevuru."
unit.utterance_translation: The tide is already high."

unit.utterance: Me- me Taguone paa buno tea
unit.utterance_translation: And - and Taguone moved to -

unit.utterance: - tea tabin voosu vo tea nao,
unit.utterance_translation: to turn back to go,

unit.utterance: ahaiki, puhana paa beera vaevuru,
unit.utterance_translation: no, the tide was already high,

unit.utterance: me roanabai teve -
unit.utterance_translation: and her mother-in-law -

unit.utterance: me roanabai teve paa nao
unit.utterance_translation: and her mother-in-law went,

unit.utterance: paa nao me takin,
unit.utterance_translation: went out of the water,

unit.utterance: me takin tea masi
unit.utterance_translation: and left the water and went to the dry reef,

unit.utterance: me Taguone he paa ponis vaevuru maa suin nae
unit.utterance_translation: while Taguone had already become heavy in her body

unit.utterance: me paa nagu bata mana tea pita,
unit.utterance_translation: and (she) was too exhausted to walk,

unit.utterance: o puhana paa antee voen ei,
unit.utterance_translation: the tide reached until here,

unit.utterance: na ponisi bata maana.
unit.utterance_translation: (she) was becoming heavy.

unit.utterance: Erau, teo vuri bona
unit.utterance_translation: And so, at that time

unit.utterance: me si - e roanabai teve paa nao tea masi,
unit.utterance_translation: her mother-in-law went to the dry reef,

unit.utterance: sun vaevuru tea masi
unit.utterance_translation: when (she) stood already on the dry reef,

unit.utterance: e Taguone paa ponisi vaevuru paa -
unit.utterance_translation: Taguone had already become heavy -

unit.utterance: paa huun a suinnae,
unit.utterance_translation: her body became liquid,

unit.utterance: paa muraka, me paa taverete tahii,
unit.utterance_translation: became soft and turned into saltwater,

unit.utterance: me paa rova komana tahii.
unit.utterance_translation: and disappeared in the sea.

unit.utterance: Me paa voosu e sinanae,
unit.utterance_translation: Her mother returned home,

unit.utterance: paa vaakoara me vaakoara bene roanabai te Taguone.
unit.utterance_translation: (she) swore and swore at Taguone's mother-in-law.

unit.utterance: Eve koa o hutate me kavara vai
unit.utterance_translation: That's just the story, and it is finished here.
